tasks.title: Draft the overall hackathon plan (objectives, target participants, rough schedule)
tasks.base_prompt:
Draft a concise overall plan. Define objectives (what outcomes we want), target participants (60-120 students, engineers, designers), and a rough schedule for the full stream. Keep assumptions explicit and minimal with budget constraints under $15K total.

Acceptance criteria: One-page plan with objectives, participant segments (60-120 people), and schedule outline; explicit assumptions and 3 quantified risks with $ impact.

files.content: Context: University‑level hackathon focused on practical prototypes. Objectives: foster collaboration, produce 15-20 demo‑ready projects, and showcase innovation to 200+ audience members. Target: 60–120 participants (40% CS/engineering, 30% design/business, 30% mixed backgrounds). Sequence: 14 tasks across two phases (planning, execution). Budget ceiling: $15K including venue, catering, prizes.

tasks.title: Propose a detailed agenda
tasks.base_prompt:
Propose a detailed agenda across the full stream: workshop blocks, mentorship windows, project time, checkpoints, and demo rehearsals. Ensure Phase 1 emphasizes drafting and Phase 2 emphasizes execution.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [1] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Agenda table with session blocks (workshops/mentoring/work); periodic checkpoints; consistency with task 1.; respects global assumptions.

files.content: Template: Morning (kickoff/workshop), Midday (team progress), Afternoon (mentoring), Evening (work time). Include at least one checkpoint every 2–3 blocks.

tasks.title: Suggest a preliminary budget (venue, catering, prizes)
tasks.base_prompt:
Draft a preliminary budget with line items for venue ($3-5K), catering (coffee/snacks + one meal per key blocks, $4-6K for 120 people), and prizes ($1-2K total). Provide ranges and a short rationale. Flag items needing quotes or confirmation.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [1] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Budget table with venue/catering/prizes ranges; rationale and items needing quotes; totals under $15K consistent with constraints.; respects global assumptions.

files.content: Baseline constraints: modest venue ($4K max), essential catering ($5K for 120 people), simple prize tiers (Best Overall $800, Best Technical $500, Best Impact $300). Aim for cost‑effective options and $3-5K sponsorship offsets to keep total under $15K.

tasks.title: Create a promotion plan with poster drafts and social media outlines
tasks.base_prompt:
Create a promotion plan: channels, timeline, sample poster headline/copy, and social media outline. Keep it consistent with objectives and target audience. Include call‑to‑action and sign‑up link placeholders.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [1] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Promotion plan: channels + timeline; poster headline/copy; social outline; CTA and sign-up link placeholders.

files.content: Audience: students, developers, designers. Channels: campus groups, tech clubs, social media, mailing lists. CTA: register, join teams, attend workshops.

tasks.title: Generate a volunteer recruitment message and role descriptions
tasks.base_prompt:
Write a concise recruitment message and define roles (check‑in, logistics, A/V support, mentoring coordination). Include estimated counts per role (15-20 total volunteers) and shift durations (defined shift durations).

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [1, 2] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Recruitment message ≤150 words; 5 roles with specific counts (15-20 total); shift durations (defined shift durations); tone clear and inclusive.

files.content: Roles: Check‑in desk (3 people); Venue logistics (4 people); A/V support (2 people); Mentor liaison (3 people); Hospitality (3-5 people). Target volunteers: 15–20 total, defined shift durations during peak activity periods.

tasks.title: Draft hackathon rules and judging criteria
tasks.base_prompt:
Draft clear rules (eligibility, team size, submission requirements, IP/reuse) and judging criteria (technical merit, originality, impact, usability, demo quality). Keep language simple and enforceable.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [1] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Rules + judging rubric (weights sum to 100%); enforceable language; aligns with agenda.

files.content: Team size: 3–5. Submission: code + brief + demo video. IP: own work; allowed libraries with attribution. Judging: weighted rubric (technical 30%, impact 25%, originality 20%, usability 15%, demo 10%).

tasks.title: Prepare a sponsorship proposal for potential sponsors
tasks.base_prompt:
Write a sponsorship proposal: 3 tiers (Bronze $1K, Silver $2.5K, Gold $5K), benefits (logo, mentions, booths, judging invites), and impact narrative. Include a one‑page version and an email outreach draft.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [3, 4] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Sponsor tiers + benefits; one-page summary + outreach email draft; impact narrative coherent.

files.content: Tiers: Bronze/Silver/Gold. Benefits: logo placement, stage mentions, demo booths, mentor slots. Emphasis: student innovation and community goodwill.

tasks.title: Summarize and confirm guest speakers and mentors
tasks.base_prompt:
Summarize target speakers/mentors and propose a confirmation plan (outreach order, fallback picks, timeslots). Provide a clean list with contact placeholders and status fields (invited/confirmed/pending).

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [4] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Speakers/mentors list with contact placeholders + status; outreach sequencing + fallback picks.

files.content: Profiles: industry engineers, startup founders, researchers. Timeslots: late block talks, peak window mentorship windows. Keep diversity across topics.

tasks.title: Design welcome kits (contents and logistics)
tasks.base_prompt:
Propose welcome kit contents (badge, schedule card, stickers, snacks) and logistics (assembly plan, batch counts, pickup process). Include a simple BOM (bill of materials).

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [2] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Welcome kit BOM with costs ($8-12/kit); assembly logistics for 120 kits; pickup process; numbers coherent with 60-120 participant estimates.; respects global assumptions.

files.content: Kits per participant (120 max): badge, quick schedule card, QR links sheet, sticker pack, energy bar. Assembly flow: 4-person table line; QA check; sealed kit; storage per session block. Cost estimate: $8-12 per kit.

tasks.title: Write a participant guideline document (agenda, logistics, conduct)
tasks.base_prompt:
Write a clear participant guideline: agenda overview, venue map/flow, check‑in process, safety & conduct, submission timelines, and support contacts. Keep the tone helpful and precise.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [2, 9] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Guideline document (≤1 page): agenda overview, venue flow, check-in, safety/conduct, submission timeline, contacts.

files.content: Sections: agenda overview; venue zones; check‑in; safety & conduct; submission deadlines; helpdesk/contacts. Keep it one page.

tasks.title: Prepare a logistics checklist (venue, catering, technical setup)
tasks.base_prompt:
Create a logistics checklist covering venue access, seating, signage, catering delivery, A/V, wi‑fi, extension cords, adapters, and backup equipment. Group by pre‑event/on‑site/post‑event.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [2, 3] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Checklist grouped by pre-event/on-site/post-event; owners per item; equipment and backups covered.; respects global assumptions.

files.content: Checklist groups: pre‑event (permits, access), on‑site (signage, catering, A/V), post‑event (cleanup, returns). Include responsible owner per item.

tasks.title: Draft instructions and duty allocations for volunteers
tasks.base_prompt:
Draft volunteer instructions per role with duty allocations by timeslot. Add escalation paths and contact sheet. Ensure coverage for check‑in, logistics, A/V, hospitality, mentor liaison.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [5, 11] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Role-wise instructions; duty allocations by timeslot; escalation paths; contact sheet present.

files.content: Structure: role summary; timeslot duties; handoff notes; contacts; escalation. Example timeslots: early block check‑in; midday logistics; late block A/V support.

tasks.title: Generate a rehearsal schedule (opening ceremony and demo program)
tasks.base_prompt:
Generate a rehearsal schedule for opening ceremony and demo program: roles involved, run‑of‑show, timing, and technical checks. Add buffer times and fallback steps.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [2, 6] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Rehearsal run-of-show with sequence labels, roles, technical checks; buffers and fallback steps included.

files.content: Opening ceremony: MC, A/V, keynote coordination. Demo program: team order, judge table setup, timer, projection tests. Buffers: reasonable per block.

tasks.title: Produce the final on‑site operations plan (check‑in, talks, meals, demos, awards)
tasks.base_prompt:
Produce a final operations plan: check‑in steps, talk slots, meal sequence, demo order, awards ceremony. Provide owner assignments, clear sequencing without exact times, and contingency notes.

Dependencies: build on outputs from tasks [2, 8, 11, 13] (use their artifacts and keep consistency).
Acceptance criteria: Final ops plan with owners, clear sequencing, equipment lists, contingency notes; coherent with prior tasks.; respects global assumptions.

files.content: Ops sections: check‑in; talks; meals; demos; awards. Include owner, sequence labels, equipment list, and contingency for delays.
